definition: to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
erhua variant of 抄近[chao1 jin4]

sentences.english: Let's cut through the woods and get ahead of them.
sentences.chinese: 咱們穿過樹林抄近路趕到他們前面去。

sentences.english: Eager to get home, I took a shortcut through an alley.
sentences.chinese: 因爲急着想回家，我就抄近路走小巷子。

sentences.english: Then he cut across a field to go home.
sentences.chinese: 然後他抄近路穿過一塊田野回家。

sentences.english: Because of the high price of oil, they are cutting corners.
sentences.chinese: 因爲石油的高價格，所以他們就抄近路。

sentences.english: Susie nicked in ahead of us when we went through the woods.
sentences.chinese: 穿越森林時，蘇茜抄近路搶到了我們的前頭。

sentences.english: We can gain some time if we cut across this field.
sentences.chinese: 我們如果抄近路穿過這片田野可以省下一些時間。

sentences.english: Don't take short-cuts through empty buildings or parking lots.
sentences.chinese: 不要從空曠的大樓或停車場那裏抄近路。

sentences.english: In order not to be late, she cut across the fields.
sentences.chinese: 爲了不遲到，她抄近路穿過田野。

sentences.english: Tom nicked in ahead of us before we arrived at the station.
sentences.chinese: 在我們到達車站之前，湯姆抄近路趕到了我們的前頭。

sentences.english: He leapt over a ditch for a shortcut.
sentences.chinese: 他越過一條小水溝抄近道。

sentences.english: They take shortcuts when the traffic is bad.
sentences.chinese: 當交通狀況不好的時候，他們會抄近路。

sentences.english: On the way back they short cut thorough the August woods.
sentences.chinese: 回家的時候，他們抄近路走進了整個八月的森林。

sentences.english: You can catch him up if you cut across the forest.
sentences.chinese: 如果你抄近路從樹林裏穿過去，就能趕上他。

sentences.english: Don't cut through the park on my way home.
sentences.chinese: 回家不要抄近道，從公園裏頭走。

sentences.english: If we think the code we're about to write is simple, we tend to cut corners.
sentences.chinese: 如果認爲要編寫的代碼很簡單，我們會抄近路。

definition: to take the back roads/to take the side streets/to take the small paths
to make a detour/to take the long route
road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
bypath/trail/bribery as a means of achieving a goal/minor arts (Confucian reference to agriculture, medicine, divination, and other professions unworthy of a gentleman)
to grope about in the dark
